result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario D Ivy Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING February 26, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  Court found the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  Bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owig is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
DNA sample, pay the surcharge.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario D Ivy Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.
Request for payment of $17.00 witness fees for witness Selenthia A. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26190406 in court 1x on 10/28/15.

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-DNA ssample; pay the surcharge.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm
Witness fee request prepared for Selenthia A. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 968.075(1)(a), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final pretrial held off record.  Case remains set for jury trial on 10/28/15.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect and all conditions as to bail to remain the same.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM037453  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/11/15

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Selenthia A.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Mario D Ivy in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet,  Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
